name: Tairua Shores Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I have to say the Coromandel Peninsula should not be placed and Tairua is a great friendly place to make your base. We stayed here for two night in a well decorated good sized room. It is very clean and owners very helpful (incl free internet access a boon for travellers). The motel is just 5 min easy walk into town along the coast line.
reviews.title: Great motel in lovely town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great pace and my only small complaint was that ne of the nights, the room got quite hot and there was no fan in the room but would definiely stay there again if I visited the area.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tairua Shores Motel for 5 nights in January 2010. The place was recommended to us by a tourist information. We had a great time and could easily have stayed longer: lots of things to see and do in the area. The location of the motel is great, perfect to explore the Coromandel peninsula. We especially loved the "guide service" of our host Glenn: Every morning we stopped by at the reception to get some insider tips for the day trip - the best beaches, the best restaurants, the best ice-cream-shops... I also liked the DVD-rental and watched a great movie on one rainy day. Greetings from Germany, Glenn!
reviews.title: Can I give it 6 out of 5? An excellent place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the Tairua Shores Motel and the owners Glenn, Allison and family made our stay one of pleasurable relaxation. Absolutely nothing was too much trouble for them, including arranging for us to be picked up from our restaraunt on New Years Eve by their lovely daughter.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: The accommodation was perfect, the location wonderful - just up from the wharf and a short walk from the shops and restaraunts. The rooms were serviced daily and had a lovely outside sitting area which was a marvellous suntrap.
reviews.title: Great Motel - Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for good value accommodation in Tairua then this is hard to beat. It comprises a small complex of 10 units and each one is very thoughtfully furnished and equipped and each has an outside area with furniture for eating and relaxing. Wireless internet is available in the units and although in theory there is a charge for this, the owner said he doesn't bother charging for the odd hour's use. The units are not air conditioned but our unit had an effective fan, and we didn't have a view, but then it's only a 5 minute walk to the waterside so not a problem. Overall, highly recommended. Tairua itself is a lovely little place, very pretty in its own right and close to some glorious coastal scenery.
reviews.title: Hard to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for just the one night and took the kids, our apartment was huge and spacious and the kitchen was well appointed and stocked with heaps of appliances, it was warm and cosy and the beds comfy and i had such a good night sleep i nearly didnt get up to wander across the road to see the magnificent sunrise, glad i did tho it was awesome!! Our hosts were warm and friendly and helpfull and the private little courtyard put the back with a bbq is just such a nice touch!! Good job, would definatley stay here again, well priced value for money in my book. Cheers.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights & loved it here. We had a 'Garden Chalet' unit. It was private & very modern & well equipped with a great courtyard.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner was very helpful & lent us towels & a spade for Hot water Beach. He also gave us lots of information on where to go to get the best out of our stay.
reviews.title: Return visits do not diminish an excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a computer in reception which you can connect your own up to or you can use the one there. Wi-fi in units would be nice!
reviews.title: Excellent motel with very friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Glen and Allison run a great motel. They make you feel very welcome and are very willing to help with all your questions and are happy to loan beach towels and spades for digging on Hot Beach! They also have free internet in the reception area.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in the Coromandel area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The chalets, with their king size beds, and private patios with table, chairs and recliner, are extremely clean and the linen is good quality. My husband and I went with my sister and brother in law for the second time. We found the motel 2 years ago and really enjoyed our stay there. As we wanted to see more of the area we naturally returned to Shores Motel again. It is very conveniently situated - 2 mins walk to the harbour for boating trips or the ferry across the water, or for a leisurely stroll along the estuary to the shops and restaurants. It had everything we wanted in a friendly environment.
reviews.title: 10/10 FOR EFFORT MADE TO RENOVATE THIS MOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had one night here and were put into one of the largest rooms which was good for us. You had a nice lounge area with a new flat screen tv plus kitchen area along with a comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The owners have done a great job making this place look the best it can. They let us use there computer for free which was a plus at the time.
reviews.title: comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was very clean and comfortable, obviously recently refurbished. Loved the little garden. Kitchen wasn't very well equipped which made it a little difficult to cook a meal but we managed. On site laundry. No internet connection in apartment but could use it in reception for free. Owner was very friendly and helpful suggesting best beaches etc, free loan of beach towels & spades for Hot Water beach. Thought Tairua was a gem of a place, wish we'd have had a week to spend there.
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: The hosts of this property are wonderful. They made us feel at home, taking care of our needs and answering questions.
reviews.title: Lovely deck,shame about the shower!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Nice place, comfy bed, private outdoor area, close to water, although there is no beach near, good walk to main shops along the water side and a real hot water cupboard! All mod cons but I couldn't find a hardwired phone. Don't bother with the bakery over the road for early morning nosh, walk the ten minutes to Sushi and Crepes restaurant. Yes, strange name.
reviews.title: Sweet and Dandy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to Glenn & Alison for a great stay in a great motel. Faultless, well equiped room, and real good bed linen make for a quality stay here. The hosts are excellent with sound advice...you would be wise to take it, we did and gained a lot extra from our stay. We just hope all our accomodation in NZ is as good as this....make sure you walk up Paku hill the views are tremendous.
reviews.title: A REAL GEM,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Tairua Shores as a base to explore the Coromandel, and it worked out great. The room was beautifully furnished, bed was super comfortable, and it had a lovely private patio where we had breakfast in the morning. We were in walking distance to restaurants and had free use of the internet. The owners were helpful in every way, from providing shovels for the hot water beach, setting us up with a good New Zealand movie for us to watch in our room, and helping us retrieve items we left at a previous hotel. Thank you Glen and Allison - I got the items in Nelson!
reviews.title: Wonderful place, wonderful people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights when touring New Zealand. The room was bright airy and attractive. There was a lovely little garden with umberella and loungers. From the back of the motel you can walk along the edge of the estuary, a quiet and beautiful walk. The tiny town centre is attractive with cafes, a supermarket and chemist. The location and ambience of this motel was a small glimpse of paradise. The owners were helpful, chatty but not intrusive. Wish I was still there.
reviews.title: The location and ambience of Tairua Shores Motel is a small glimpse of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a studio the best we have ever stayed in at tairua shores motel in January 2010 everything about our stay was very good from the very nice clean room to the sunny garden, Glenn and Alison were very helpful about where to visit and the area, we wished we could have stayed longer but had to move on, we cant wait for our next visit
reviews.title: Lovely stay

aka: Tairua Shores Motel South Pacific - New Zealand
description: Tairua Shores accommodation has all been fully refurbished and consists of 4 family units, each unit has a separate bedroom with king size bed, separate full kitchen,separate bathroom, lounge and own deck with bbq. Two units have views over looking the harbour. 3 spacious garden chalets plus 2 superior garden chalets. All chalets have a king size bed, separate bathroom, kitchen and own private very sunny garden deck. Cooked and continental breakfast delivered to your unit on request.
